title: Update Media Buy Request
description: Request parameters for updating campaign and package settings

media_buy_id.description: Publisher's ID of the media buy to update

buyer_ref.description: Buyer's reference for the media buy to update

paused.description: Pause/resume the entire media buy (true = paused, false = active)

start_time.title: Start Timing
start_time.description: Campaign start timing: 'asap' or ISO 8601 date-time

oneOf.description: Start campaign as soon as possible
Scheduled start date/time in ISO 8601 format

end_time.description: New end date/time in ISO 8601 format

items.title: Package Update
items.description: Package update configuration for update_media_buy. Identifies package by package_id or buyer_ref and specifies fields to modify. Fields not present are left unchanged. Note: product_id, format_ids, and pricing_option_id cannot be changed after creation.

package_id.description: Publisher's ID of package to update

buyer_ref.description: Buyer's reference for the package to update

budget.description: Updated budget allocation for this package in the currency specified by the pricing option

enumDescriptions.even: Allocate remaining budget evenly over remaining campaign duration (default)
enumDescriptions.asap: Spend remaining budget as quickly as possible
enumDescriptions.front_loaded: Allocate more remaining budget earlier in the remaining campaign period

bid_price.description: Updated bid price for auction-based pricing options (only applies when pricing_option is auction-based)

impressions.description: Updated impression goal for this package

paused.description: Pause/resume specific package (true = paused, false = active)

optimization_goal.title: Optimization Goal
optimization_goal.description: Conversion optimization goal for a package. Tells the seller which event source and event type to optimize delivery against. Provide at most one of target_roas or target_cpa. If neither is provided, the seller optimizes for maximum conversions within budget.

event_source_id.description: Event source to optimize against (must be configured on this account via sync_event_sources)

event_type.title: Event Type
event_type.description: Event type to optimize for (e.g. purchase, lead)

enumDescriptions.view_content: User viewed specific content (product, article, etc.)
enumDescriptions.select_content: User selected or clicked on content (article, video, etc.)
enumDescriptions.select_item: User selected a specific product or item from a list
enumDescriptions.share: User shared content via social or messaging
enumDescriptions.add_to_cart: User added an item to cart
enumDescriptions.remove_from_cart: User removed an item from cart
enumDescriptions.add_to_wishlist: User added an item to a wishlist
enumDescriptions.refund: A purchase was fully or partially refunded (adjusts ROAS)
enumDescriptions.lead: User expressed interest (form submission, signup, etc.)
enumDescriptions.qualify_lead: Lead qualified by sales or scoring criteria
enumDescriptions.close_convert_lead: Lead converted to a customer or closed deal
enumDescriptions.disqualify_lead: Lead disqualified or marked as not viable
enumDescriptions.subscribe: User subscribed to a service or newsletter
enumDescriptions.schedule: User scheduled an appointment or event
enumDescriptions.submit_application: User submitted an application (loan, job, etc.)

target_roas.description: Target return on ad spend (e.g. 4.0 = $4 conversion value per $1 spent). Mutually exclusive with target_cpa.

target_cpa.description: Target cost per acquisition in the buy currency. Mutually exclusive with target_roas.

attribution_window.description: Attribution window for this optimization goal. Values must match an option declared in the seller's conversion_tracking.attribution_windows capability. When omitted, the seller uses their default window.

targeting_overlay.title: Targeting Overlay
targeting_overlay.description: Optional restriction overlays for media buys. Most targeting should be expressed in the brief and handled by the publisher. These fields are for functional restrictions: geographic (RCT testing, regulatory compliance), age verification (alcohol, gambling), device platform (app compatibility), and language (localization).

geo_countries.description: Restrict delivery to specific countries. ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes (e.g., 'US', 'GB', 'DE').

geo_countries_exclude.description: Exclude specific countries from delivery. ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes (e.g., 'US', 'GB', 'DE').

geo_regions.description: Restrict delivery to specific regions/states. ISO 3166-2 subdivision codes (e.g., 'US-CA', 'GB-SCT').

geo_regions_exclude.description: Exclude specific regions/states from delivery. ISO 3166-2 subdivision codes (e.g., 'US-CA', 'GB-SCT').

geo_metros.description: Restrict delivery to specific metro areas. Each entry specifies the classification system and target values. Seller must declare supported systems in get_adcp_capabilities.

values.description: Metro codes within the system (e.g., ['501', '602'] for Nielsen DMAs)

geo_metros_exclude.description: Exclude specific metro areas from delivery. Each entry specifies the classification system and excluded values. Seller must declare supported systems in get_adcp_capabilities.

values.description: Metro codes to exclude within the system (e.g., ['501', '602'] for Nielsen DMAs)

geo_postal_areas.description: Restrict delivery to specific postal areas. Each entry specifies the postal system and target values. Seller must declare supported systems in get_adcp_capabilities.

system.title: Postal Code System
system.description: Postal code system (e.g., 'us_zip', 'gb_outward'). System name encodes country and precision.

values.description: Postal codes within the system (e.g., ['10001', '10002'] for us_zip)

geo_postal_areas_exclude.description: Exclude specific postal areas from delivery. Each entry specifies the postal system and excluded values. Seller must declare supported systems in get_adcp_capabilities.

system.title: Postal Code System
system.description: Postal code system (e.g., 'us_zip', 'gb_outward'). System name encodes country and precision.

values.description: Postal codes to exclude within the system (e.g., ['10001', '10002'] for us_zip)

daypart_targets.description: Restrict delivery to specific time windows. Each entry specifies days of week and an hour range.

items.title: Daypart Target
items.description: A time window for daypart targeting. Specifies days of week and an hour range. start_hour is inclusive, end_hour is exclusive (e.g., 6-10 = 6:00am to 10:00am). Follows the Google Ads AdScheduleInfo / DV360 DayPartTargeting pattern.

days.description: Days of week this window applies to. Use multiple days for compact targeting (e.g., monday-friday in one object).

items.title: Day of Week
items.description: Days of the week for daypart targeting

end_hour.description: End hour (exclusive), 1-24 in 24-hour format. 10 = 10:00am, 24 = midnight. Must be greater than start_hour.

label.description: Optional human-readable name for this time window (e.g., 'Morning Drive', 'Prime Time')

axe_include_segment.description: AXE segment ID to include for targeting

axe_exclude_segment.description: AXE segment ID to exclude from targeting

frequency_cap.title: Frequency Cap
frequency_cap.description: Frequency capping settings for package-level application

property_list.title: Property List Reference
property_list.description: Reference to a property list for targeting specific properties within this product. The package runs on the intersection of the product's publisher_properties and this list. Sellers SHOULD return a validation error if the product has property_targeting_allowed: false.

agent_url.description: URL of the agent managing the property list

list_id.description: Identifier for the property list within the agent

auth_token.description: JWT or other authorization token for accessing the list. Optional if the list is public or caller has implicit access.

age_restriction.description: Age restriction for compliance. Use for legal requirements (alcohol, gambling), not audience targeting.

verification_required.description: Whether verified age (not inferred) is required for compliance

accepted_methods.description: Accepted verification methods. If omitted, any method the platform supports is acceptable.

items.title: Age Verification Method
items.description: Methods for verifying user age for compliance. Does not include 'inferred' as it is not accepted for regulatory compliance.

device_platform.description: Restrict to specific platforms. Use for technical compatibility (app only works on iOS). Values from Sec-CH-UA-Platform standard, extended for CTV.

items.title: Device Platform
items.description: Operating system platforms for device targeting. Browser values from Sec-CH-UA-Platform standard, extended for CTV.

language.description: Restrict to users with specific language preferences. ISO 639-1 codes (e.g., 'en', 'es', 'fr').

creative_assignments.description: Replace creative assignments for this package with optional weights and placement targeting. Uses replacement semantics - omit to leave assignments unchanged.

items.title: Creative Assignment
items.description: Assignment of a creative asset to a package with optional placement targeting. Used in create_media_buy and update_media_buy requests. Note: sync_creatives does not support placement_ids - use create/update_media_buy for placement-level targeting.

placement_ids.description: Optional array of placement IDs where this creative should run. When omitted, the creative runs on all placements in the package. References placement_id values from the product's placements array.

creatives.description: Upload new creative assets and assign to this package (creatives will be added to library). Use creative_assignments instead for existing library creatives.

items.title: Creative Asset
items.description: Creative asset for upload to library - supports static assets, generative formats, and third-party snippets

format_id.title: Format ID
format_id.description: Format identifier specifying which format this creative conforms to. Can be: (1) concrete format_id referencing a format with fixed dimensions, (2) template format_id referencing a template format, or (3) parameterized format_id with dimensions/duration parameters for template formats.

agent_url.description: URL of the agent that defines this format (e.g., 'https://creatives.adcontextprotocol.org' for standard formats, or 'https://publisher.com/.well-known/adcp/sales' for custom formats)

id.description: Format identifier within the agent's namespace (e.g., 'display_static', 'video_hosted', 'audio_standard'). When used alone, references a template format. When combined with dimension/duration fields, creates a parameterized format ID for a specific variant.

width.description: Width in pixels for visual formats. When specified, height must also be specified. Both fields together create a parameterized format ID for dimension-specific variants.

height.description: Height in pixels for visual formats. When specified, width must also be specified. Both fields together create a parameterized format ID for dimension-specific variants.

duration_ms.description: Duration in milliseconds for time-based formats (video, audio). When specified, creates a parameterized format ID. Omit to reference a template format without parameters.

assets.description: Assets required by the format, keyed by asset_role

oneOf.title: Image Asset
oneOf.description: Image asset with URL and dimensions

format.description: Image file format (jpg, png, gif, webp, etc.)

oneOf.title: Video Asset
oneOf.description: Video asset with URL and technical specifications including audio track properties

container_format.description: Video container format (mp4, webm, mov, etc.)

video_codec.description: Video codec used (h264, h265, vp9, av1, prores, etc.)

video_bitrate_kbps.description: Video stream bitrate in kilobits per second

frame_rate.description: Frame rate as string to preserve precision (e.g., '23.976', '29.97', '30')

frame_rate_type.description: Whether the video uses constant (CFR) or variable (VFR) frame rate

hdr_format.description: HDR format if applicable, or 'sdr' for standard dynamic range

moov_atom_position.description: Position of moov atom in MP4 container

has_audio.description: Whether the video contains an audio track

audio_codec.description: Audio codec used (aac, aac_lc, he_aac, pcm, mp3, ac3, eac3, etc.)

audio_bitrate_kbps.description: Audio bitrate in kilobits per second

captions_url.description: URL to captions file (WebVTT, SRT, etc.)

transcript_url.description: URL to text transcript of the video content

audio_description_url.description: URL to audio description track for visually impaired users

oneOf.title: Audio Asset
oneOf.description: Audio asset with URL and technical specifications

container_format.description: Audio container/file format (mp3, m4a, aac, wav, ogg, flac, etc.)

codec.description: Audio codec used (aac, aac_lc, he_aac, pcm, mp3, vorbis, opus, flac, ac3, eac3, etc.)

transcript_url.description: URL to text transcript of the audio content

accessibility.description: Self-declared accessibility properties for this opaque creative

alt_text.description: Text alternative describing the creative content

keyboard_navigable.description: Whether the creative can be fully operated via keyboard

motion_control.description: Whether the creative respects prefers-reduced-motion or provides pause/stop controls

screen_reader_tested.description: Whether the creative has been tested with screen readers

oneOf.title: Promoted Offerings
oneOf.description: Complete offering specification combining brand manifest, product selectors, and optional SI agent endpoint. Provides all context needed for creative generation and/or conversational experiences about what is being promoted. When si_agent_url is present, hosts can connect users to conversational experiences about any of the offerings.

brand_manifest.title: Brand Manifest Reference
brand_manifest.description: Brand information manifest containing assets, themes, and guidelines. Can be provided inline or as a URL reference to a hosted manifest.

url.description: Primary brand URL for context and asset discovery. Creative agents can infer brand information from this URL.

privacy_policy_url.description: URL to the brand's privacy policy. Used for consumer consent flows when personal data may be shared with the advertiser. AI platforms can use this to present explicit privacy choices to users before data handoff.

logos.description: Brand logo assets with structured fields for orientation, background compatibility, and variant type. Use the orientation, background, and variant enum fields for reliable filtering by creative agents.

orientation.description: Logo aspect ratio orientation. square: ~1:1, horizontal: wide, vertical: tall, stacked: vertically arranged elements

background.description: Background compatibility. dark-bg: use on dark backgrounds, light-bg: use on light backgrounds, transparent-bg: has transparent background

variant.description: Logo variant type. primary: main logo, secondary: alternative, icon: symbol only, wordmark: text only, full-lockup: complete logo

tags.description: Additional semantic tags for custom categorization beyond the standard orientation, background, and variant fields.

usage.description: Human-readable description of when to use this logo variant (e.g., 'Primary logo for use on light backgrounds', 'Icon-only variant for small formats')

colors.description: Brand color palette. Each role accepts a single hex color or an array of hex colors for brands with multiple values per role.

font_urls.description: URLs to web font files if using custom fonts

tone.description: Brand voice and messaging tone guidelines for creative agents.

oneOf.description: Simple tone descriptors for backwards compatibility

voice.description: High-level voice descriptor (e.g., 'warm and inviting', 'professional and trustworthy')

attributes.description: Personality traits that characterize the brand voice

dos.description: Specific guidance for copy generation - what TO do

donts.description: Guardrails to avoid brand violations - what NOT to do

voice.description: Brand voice configuration for audio/conversational experiences

avatar.description: Brand avatar configuration for visual conversational experiences

assets.description: Brand asset library with explicit assets and tags. Assets are referenced inline with URLs pointing to CDN-hosted files.

asset_type.title: Asset Content Type
asset_type.description: Type of asset. Note: Brand manifests typically contain basic media assets (image, video, audio, text). Code assets (html, javascript, css) and ad markup (vast, daast) are usually not part of brand asset libraries.

product_catalog.description: Product catalog information for e-commerce advertisers. Enables SKU-level creative generation and product selection.

feed_format.description: Format of the product feed. Use 'openai_product_feed' for feeds conforming to the OpenAI Commerce Product Feed specification.

categories.description: Product categories available in the catalog (for filtering)

last_updated.description: When the product catalog was last updated

update_frequency.description: How frequently the product catalog is updated

agentic_checkout.description: Agentic checkout endpoint configuration. Enables AI agents to complete purchases on behalf of users through a structured checkout API.

endpoint.description: Base URL for checkout session API (e.g., https://merchant.com/api/checkout_sessions)

spec.description: Checkout API specification implemented by the endpoint

supported_payment_providers.description: Payment providers supported by this checkout endpoint

disclaimers.description: Legal disclaimers or required text that must appear in creatives

created_date.description: When this brand manifest was created

updated_date.description: When this brand manifest was last updated

examples.description: Example with both URL and name
Example: white-label brand without dedicated URL
Full brand manifest with all fields

Primary logo for use on dark backgrounds

disclaimers.text: Results may vary. Consult a professional before use.

oneOf.description: URL to a hosted brand manifest JSON file. The manifest at this URL must conform to the brand-manifest.json schema.

examples.description: URL string reference to hosted manifest

si_agent_url.description: MCP endpoint URL for the brand's SI agent. When present, hosts can connect users to conversational experiences about any of the offerings. The agent handles si_get_offering lookups and full conversations.

product_selectors.title: Promoted Products
product_selectors.description: Selectors to choose which products/offerings from the brand manifest product catalog to promote

manifest_gtins.description: GTIN product identifiers for cross-retailer catalog matching. Accepts standard GTIN formats (GTIN-8, UPC-A/GTIN-12, EAN-13/GTIN-13, GTIN-14).

manifest_skus.description: Direct product SKU references from the brand manifest product catalog

manifest_tags.description: Select products by tags from the brand manifest product catalog (e.g., 'organic', 'sauces', 'holiday')

manifest_category.description: Select products from a specific category in the brand manifest product catalog (e.g., 'beverages/soft-drinks', 'food/sauces')

manifest_query.description: Natural language query to select products from the brand manifest (e.g., 'all Kraft Heinz pasta sauces', 'organic products under $20')

examples.description: Cross-retailer GTIN matching for commerce media product discovery
Direct SKU selection for specific products from brand manifest

Natural language product selection from brand manifest

data.manifest_query: all Kraft Heinz pasta sauces under $5

offerings.description: Offerings available for promotion. Each offering can include creative assets (via portfolio_ref or inline assets) for traditional ads. When si_agent_url is set at the parent level, hosts can offer conversational experiences about any of these offerings.

items.title: Offering
items.description: A promotable offering from a brand. Can represent a campaign, product promotion, service, or any other thing the brand wants to make available. Offerings can be promoted via traditional creatives (using portfolio_ref or assets) or conversational SI experiences (via si_agent_url at the promoted-offerings level).

offering_id.description: Unique identifier for this offering. Used by hosts to reference specific offerings in si_get_offering calls.

name.description: Human-readable offering name (e.g., 'Winter Sale', 'Free Trial', 'Enterprise Platform')

tagline.description: Short promotional tagline for the offering

valid_from.description: When the offering becomes available. If not specified, offering is immediately available.

valid_to.description: When the offering expires. If not specified, offering has no expiration.

checkout_url.description: URL for checkout/purchase flow when the brand doesn't support agentic checkout.

landing_url.description: Landing page URL for this offering.

assets.description: Assets specific to this offering (images, videos, copy)

items.description: Asset definition using standard asset structure

portfolio_ref.description: Reference to a creative portfolio for this offering. Portfolios contain organized creative assets across formats, enabling consistent ad delivery for this specific offering.

keywords.description: Keywords for matching this offering to user intent. Hosts use these for retrieval/relevance scoring.

ext.title: Extension Object
ext.description: Extension object for platform-specific, vendor-namespaced parameters. Extensions are always optional and must be namespaced under a vendor/platform key (e.g., ext.gam, ext.roku). Used for custom capabilities, partner-specific configuration, and features being proposed for standardization.

url_type.title: URL Asset Type
url_type.description: Type of URL asset: 'clickthrough' for user click destination (landing page), 'tracker_pixel' for impression/event tracking via HTTP request (fires GET, expects pixel/204 response), 'tracker_script' for measurement SDKs that must load as <script> tag (OMID verification, native event trackers using method:2)

description.description: Description of what this URL points to

inputs.description: Preview contexts for generative formats - defines what scenarios to generate previews for

name.description: Human-readable name for this preview variant

macros.description: Macro values to apply for this preview

context_description.description: Natural language description of the context for AI-generated content

tags.description: User-defined tags for organization and searchability

status.title: Creative Status
status.description: For generative creatives: set to 'approved' to finalize, 'rejected' to request regeneration with updated assets/message. Omit for non-generative creatives (system will set based on processing state).

enumDescriptions.processing: Creative is being processed or transcoded
enumDescriptions.approved: Creative has been approved and is ready for delivery
enumDescriptions.rejected: Creative has been rejected due to policy or technical issues
enumDescriptions.archived: Creative has been archived and is excluded from default queries

weight.description: Optional delivery weight for creative rotation when uploading via create_media_buy or update_media_buy (0-100). If omitted, platform determines rotation. Only used during upload to media buy - not stored in creative library.

placement_ids.description: Optional array of placement IDs where this creative should run when uploading via create_media_buy or update_media_buy. References placement_id values from the product's placements array. If omitted, creative runs on all placements. Only used during upload to media buy - not stored in creative library.

ext.title: Extension Object
ext.description: Extension object for platform-specific, vendor-namespaced parameters. Extensions are always optional and must be namespaced under a vendor/platform key (e.g., ext.gam, ext.roku). Used for custom capabilities, partner-specific configuration, and features being proposed for standardization.

reporting_webhook.title: Reporting Webhook
reporting_webhook.description: Optional webhook configuration for automated reporting delivery. Updates the reporting configuration for this media buy.

url.description: Webhook endpoint URL for reporting notifications

token.description: Optional client-provided token for webhook validation. Echoed back in webhook payload to validate request authenticity.

schemes.description: Array of authentication schemes. Supported: ['Bearer'] for simple token auth, ['HMAC-SHA256'] for signature verification (recommended for production)

items.title: Authentication Scheme
items.description: Authentication schemes for push notification endpoints

credentials.description: Credentials for authentication. For Bearer: token sent in Authorization header. For HMAC-SHA256: shared secret used to generate signature. Minimum 32 characters. Exchanged out-of-band during onboarding.

reporting_frequency.description: Frequency for automated reporting delivery. Must be supported by all products in the media buy.

requested_metrics.description: Optional list of metrics to include in webhook notifications. If omitted, all available metrics are included. Must be subset of product's available_metrics.

items.title: Available Metric
items.description: Standard delivery and performance metrics available for reporting

push_notification_config.title: Push Notification Config
push_notification_config.description: Optional webhook configuration for async update notifications. Publisher will send webhook when update completes if operation takes longer than immediate response time. This is separate from reporting_webhook which configures ongoing campaign reporting.

url.description: Webhook endpoint URL for task status notifications

token.description: Optional client-provided token for webhook validation. Echoed back in webhook payload to validate request authenticity.

schemes.description: Array of authentication schemes. Supported: ['Bearer'] for simple token auth, ['HMAC-SHA256'] for signature verification (recommended for production)

items.title: Authentication Scheme
items.description: Authentication schemes for push notification endpoints

credentials.description: Credentials for authentication. For Bearer: token sent in Authorization header. For HMAC-SHA256: shared secret used to generate signature. Minimum 32 characters. Exchanged out-of-band during onboarding.

context.title: Context Object
context.description: Opaque correlation data that is echoed unchanged in responses. Used for internal tracking, UI session IDs, trace IDs, and other caller-specific identifiers that don't affect protocol behavior. Context data is never parsed by AdCP agents - it's simply preserved and returned.

ext.title: Extension Object
ext.description: Extension object for platform-specific, vendor-namespaced parameters. Extensions are always optional and must be namespaced under a vendor/platform key (e.g., ext.gam, ext.roku). Used for custom capabilities, partner-specific configuration, and features being proposed for standardization.

_bundled.note: This is a bundled schema with all $ref resolved inline. For the modular version with references, use the parent directory.
